pageTitle: Itinerary for Wednesday, June 6, 2018 | Prime Minister of Canada
articleHtml:
Note: All times local

Ottawa, Ontario

10 a.m.    The Prime Minister will attend the National Caucus meeting.

2 p.m.      The Prime Minister will attend Question Period.

3:55 p.m. The Prime Minister will welcome the President of France, Emmanuel Macron, to Parliament Hill.

Peace Tower Entrance
Centre Block
Parliament Hill

Note for media:

    • Photo opportunity

4 p.m.      The Prime Minister will hold a bilateral meeting with the President of France, Emmanuel Macron.

Prime Minister’s Office
Centre Block
Parliament Hill

Note for media:

    • Pooled photo opportunity at the beginning of the meeting

4:30 p.m.   The Prime Minister, the Minister of Foreign Affairs, Chrystia Freeland, the Minister of Innovation, Science and Economic Development, Navdeep Bains, and the Minister of International Development and La Francophonie, Marie-Claude Bibeau, will hold an expanded meeting with the President of France.

Cabinet Room
Centre Block
Parliament Hill

Note for media:

    • Closed to media

7:15 p.m.   The Prime Minister and Ms. Sophie Grégoire Trudeau will host a dinner for the President of France and Mrs. Macron.

Note for media:

    • Closed to media

Media appearance

5:30 p.m. ET An interview with the Prime Minister will air on Global National and globalnews.ca with Dawna Friesen.
